intro: Mormodes chrysantha, commonly known as the yellow mormodes, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. It has simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
